item.title: Tensor Factorizations of Southern Ocean
item.description: Understanding the climate system is difficult given its dependence on a wide range of length and timescales. Analyzing Earth system model (ESM) data, such as that from the Energy Exascale Earth System Model (E3SM), is further complicated due to the complex interactions between different components of the Earthâ€™s system model. Indeed, most of climate science focuses on single component analysis, e.g. ocean or sea ice. At present, ESMs are constructed to understand average statistics, such as total conservation of heat and moisture.
